types.html:
biais de sélection m (plural biais de sélection)

  1. selection bias (bias introduced by the selection of individuals, groups, or data for analysis in such a way that proper randomization is not achieved, thereby ensuring that the sample obtained is not representative of the population intended to be analyzed)

See also

[edit]
  • biais des survivants

title: biais de sélection
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /bjɛ d(ə) se.lɛk.sjɔ̃/
